title: BMW Tunnel
subtitle: Event Installation
description: An audiovisual installation that recreated the visceral experience of walking down a tunnel alive with the sounds of anticipation, and then running into a packed stadium that explodes with a panorama of passionate supporters. Combined MAX/MSP for audio, Arduino for real camera flashes and openFrameworks for live animation.

title: Pandora
subtitle: Event Installation
description: We created bespoke interactive animation scenes for the launch of the Pandora jewellery ranges. Kinect sensor for motion tracking and Processing for generative graphics.

title: SAB Kickstart Wall
subtitle: Event Installation
description: A giant spanned projection wall with animation and video triggered by hidden floor sensors.

title: Virtual Dealership
subtitle: Permanent Installation
description: A bespoke Virtual Dealership experience created for Bidvest Automotive - featuring Augmented Reality, multi-screen sychronisation, 3D graphics and gesture-controlled interfaces to take dealerships into the future.

title: Flora Give with Your Heart
subtitle: Expo Installation
description: Winner of the stand of the year for the Comrades Marathon exhibition, we provided technology for the 'Give with your heart' theme. Participants could 'donate heartbeats' by running, cyling or playing Kinect games - heart-rate monitors were connected to custom visualisations and a database to count the heartbeats collected.

title: Street Choir @FutureSounds
subtitle: Hackathon Installation
description: An installation created for the FutureSounds workshop facilitated by The Constitute (based in Berlin). Arduino-connected sensors turned the mic on when someone approached, and a Leap Motion allowed the effects on the voice loop to be controlled using hand-tracking.

title: Pixels of Purpose
subtitle: Event Installation
description: For a Singularity University 'custom programme' event, we created a suitably high-tech arrival/registration experience. A Kinect depth camera image created a realtime stylised silhouette on screen, and AR tag recognition was used to match the delegate's details to load profile information.

title: Blueville
subtitle: Corporate Staff Mobile Game
description: A local bank needed to communicate some key messages about customer service to its employees. Instead of an email campaign, we turned the whole thing into a mobile campaign. Amazingly, we got it to work for 3 platforms: Android, iOS and Blackberry OS 7 (which was very popular at the time).

title: BMW Induction App
subtitle: App + Multiplayer Game
description: We turned BMW South Africa's staff induction process into a gamified mobile app. To ensure that inductees actually engaged with the content, a short quiz tested their knowledge at the end of each Chapter, and their progress against other new staff members was tracked on a leaderboard.

title: Beef Easy
subtitle: Recipe App
description: A local beef supplier needed to connect more with consumers. We created a new brand for them, 'Beef Easy', and a mobile app that made cooking beef a little less intimidating for the novice.

title: Harnessing the Hackers
subtitle: Conference Workshop
description: I presented a very well-attended workshop in the main auditorium for the Hello Ambassador 2016 Creative Festival, a conference for South African creatives and entrepreneurs. The audience loved getting involved - playing music with a Makey Makey and turning a Thesaurus API into live digital art.

title: Magnesium Eventing Technology
subtitle: Software Product
description: I co-founded an offshoot of our Interactive Design department - a brand called Magnesium which specialises in technology products for the Eventing industry. Our flagship product is a cloud-based Event App which greatly simplifies event management, networking and communications. Built with AngularJS, NodeJS (Strongloop Loopback) and MongoDB.

title: Video Hop
subtitle: Hardware/Software Product
description: I created a smart Wifi box which combines a captive portal as well as a powerful media server. Mobile data is expensive in South Africa, so this device allows rich content to be synchronised once and then streamed for free from the Wifi box itself. The 3D-printed case design is also my own. Uses Banana Pi, Debian Linux, FreeRADIUS, RadiusDesk and CoovaChilli.

title: NodeJS Leap Motion MIDI
subtitle: Open Source / Personal Project
description: I created a smart Wifi box which combines a captive portal as well as a powerful media server. Mobile data is expensive in South Africa, so this device allows rich content to be synchronised once and then streamed for free from the Wifi box itself. The 3D-printed case design is also my own. Uses Banana Pi, Debian Linux, FreeRADIUS, RadiusDesk and CoovaChilli.
